page.title: 08Gayton Hall
page.content: {Gayton Hall {*********** Gayton Hall is part of the old Gayton village. It was{built in 1663}and was {known for its dove cot}or columbarium where pigeons were kept for food. The {notable family}were the{Gleggs}, well- known for their hospitality to travellers going to board ships at Parkgate.{William III stayed at the {hall in 1689.}Two{fir trees}planted in the garden to celebrate the royal visit were named{William and Mary. The interior of the{hall is still {preserved}but inside it has been converted into flats and the stable turned into garages.
